entry.title: Fresh Meat (Beef Controls) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the provisions of the Beef (Emergency Control) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996 (S.R. 1996 No. 132), as amended, by prohibiting the sale for human consumption of meat derived from bovine animals slaughtered on or after 29th March 1996 and which, at the time of slaughter, were more than 2½ years of age (regulation 3(1)).

entry.title: Beef (Emergency Control) (Revocation) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996
Johne’s Disease (Revocation) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Johne’s Disease Order (Northern Ireland) 1976 and the Johne’s Disease (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 1989.

entry.title: Diseases of Animals (Modification) (No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: This Order modifies Schedule 2 to the Diseases of Animals (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 (power to slaughter animals and pay compensation) by deleting the references to Johne’s Disease in Parts I and II of that Schedule.

entry.title: Specified Diseases (Notification and Movement Restrictions) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: This Order amends the Specified Diseases (Notification and Movement Restrictions) Order (Northern Ireland) 1991 (“the 1991 Order”) by adding to the list of specified diseases in Schedule 1, Jaagsiekte complex and Johne’s disease in sheep and goats. The effect is to make these diseases, where they affect sheep and goats, subject to the controls specified in the 1991 Order.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Oil and Chemical Pollution of Fish and Plants) (Partial Revocation No. 4) Order 1996

category.term: PUBLIC HEALTH, ENGLAND AND WALES;CONTAMINATION OF FOOD
PUBLIC HEALTH, NORTHERN IRELAND;CONTAMINATION OF FOOD

entry.title: The Local Government (Access to Information) (Scotland) Order 1996
The Teachers' Superannuation (Provision of Information and Administrative Expenses etc.) Regulations 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 172 of the Pensions Act 1995 (“the 1995 Act”) and relate to certain individuals who have been active members of the Teachers' Superannuation Scheme.

entry.title: The Jobseekers (1995 Order) (Commencement No. 4) Order (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: This, the fourth Order commencing provisions of the Jobseekers (Northern Ireland) Order 1995 (“the Order”), provides for the coming into operation of paragraph 1 of Schedule 2 to the Order on 2nd September 1996 and for the whole of the remainder of the Order, in so far as not already in operation, on 7th October 1996.

entry.title: The Teachers' Superannuation (Amendment) Regulations 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Teachers' Superannuation (Consolidation) Regulations 1988 (the principal Regulations).

entry.title: The Teachers (Compensation for Premature Retirement and Redundancy) (Scotland) Regulations 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for compensation for premature retirement of certain teachers and also provide for compensation on redundancy to certain teachers in addition to the normal statutory compensation. They consolidate and replace the provisions of the Teachers' (Compensation for Premature Retirement) (Scotland) Regulations 1980 (“the 1980 Regulations”), the Teachers' (Compensation for Redundancy and Premature Retirement) (Scotland) Regulations 1984 and relevant amending instruments. Some amendments of substance are made compared to the previous provisions.

entry.title: The Noise Act 1996 (Commencement No. 1) Order 1996
The Housing (Change of Landlord) (Payment of Disposal Cost by Instalments) (Amendment No. 3) Regulations 1996
The Deregulation (Slaughterhouses Act 1974 and Slaughter of Animals (Scotland) Act 1980) Order 1996
The Jobseekers Act 1995 (Commencement No. 4) Order 1996
The Pharmaceutical Qualifications (Recognition) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Pharmacy (Northern Ireland) Order 1976 (“the 1976 Order”) which regulates the practice of pharmacy in Northern Ireland.

entry.title: Traffic Signs (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: These regulations further amend the Traffic Signs Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1979 by—

entry.title: The Specified Bovine Material (Treatment and Disposal) (No. 3) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations re-enact the Specified Bovine Material (Treatment and Disposal) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996, which cease to have effect as a consequence of the repeal of the remaining provisions of the Food (Northern Ireland) Order 1989. They implement various Directives first specified in the Specified Bovine Offal (Treatment and Disposal) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 and the Mechanically Recovered Meat Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995.

entry.title: Explosives (Fireworks) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996
entry.summary: These Regulations prohibit the possession, purchase, sale or use of certain categories of fireworks, except under licence issued by the Secretary of State, to whom application shall be made in writing. A licence fee will be payable (regulations 4, 5 and 10). Bodies exempt from the general prohibition are listed (regulation 8).

entry.title: The Bridgend and District National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 1996

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES
